info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 5:18PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Fulton, southeastern Herkimer and western Montgomery Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 517 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Springfield, or 9 miles northeast of Cooperstown, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Canajoharie, Fort Plain, St. Johnsville, Ephratah, Ames, Warren, Fultonville, Palatine Bridge, Nelliston, Cook Corners, Mindenville, Davys Corners, Fical Corners, Ripple Corners, McKinley, West Saint Johnsville, Sand Hill, Yosts, Brookman Corners and Van Hornesville. This includes Interstate 90 near exit 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern and east central New York.
